eventDescription: Infinity Hunt is a high-energy, treasure hunt-style event that fuses the thrill of discovery with the power of intellect. Participants will embark on a journey filled with aptitude challenges, coding puzzles, and mind-bending clues ‚Äî all designed to test their logic, speed, and problem-solving skills. Crack codes, connect the dots, and race against time as you unlock each level and chase down the final destination. It‚Äôs not just a hunt ‚Äî it‚Äôs a battle of brains!
venue: üìç New Building ‚Äì Labs , DYPCET Kolhapur
eligibleParticipants: Infinity War is open to all engineering students, regardless of their branch or year of study. Whether you're a first-year curious coder, a final-year project wizard, or simply someone who loves solving real-world problems ‚Äî there's a space for your talent here.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Mandatory Attendance
rulesAndRegulations.description: All participants must report on time and attend the entire event from start to end (9:30 AM to 3:30 PM). Late entries or early exits may lead to disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Group Participation Etiquette
rulesAndRegulations.description: Groups must stay together during the hunt. Splitting up to solve clues individually is not allowed and will result in penalty points.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Respect for Venue
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants must not damage property or tamper with equipment in labs, cabins, or buildings. Any such behavior will lead to immediate disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: No External Help
rulesAndRegulations.description: The use of mobile phones, the internet, or assistance from outsiders is strictly prohibited unless specified in a challenge. All answers must be solved independently by the team.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Clue Integrity
rulesAndRegulations.description: Do not remove, hide, or alter any clues once found. If you find a clue meant for another team, report it to the coordinators.

eventRounds.title: Aptitude Clash
eventRounds.description: Participants will face logic-based aptitude and reasoning questions. Top scorers will move to the next round.

eventRounds.title: Code Crypt
eventRounds.description: A coding challenge where participants solve puzzles or decode logic to find clues.

eventRounds.title: The Hunt
eventRounds.description: The ultimate treasure hunt round across the venue, filled with hidden clues, riddles, and tech puzzles.

warnings: Be ready for outdoor and indoor challenges.

faqs.question: Can I participate alone?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can register as an individual or in a group of up to 4 members.

faqs.question: What if I miss the registration deadline?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, late registrations will not be accepted. Please register before the deadline.

faqs.question: Is there any age limit for participants?
faqs.answer: No, there is no age limit. All engineering students are welcome to participate.

faqs.question: Will food be provided during the event?
faqs.answer: Yes, lunch and refreshments will be provided to all participants.

eventDescription: CodeRumble is a fast-paced competitive coding and debugging event designed to test participants‚Äô problem-solving skills under pressure. This event includes logical challenges, real-world debugging, and algorithm optimization rounds.
venue: IT Seminar Hall
eligibleParticipants: Open to all engineering students with a basic understanding of programming.

rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants are not allowed to use the internet during coding rounds unless explicitly permitted in a challenge.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Individual Effort
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each participant must solve problems independently. Collaboration during solo rounds will result in disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Respect Time Limits
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each round has strict time constraints. Late submissions will not be evaluated.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Software & Environment
rulesAndRegulations.description: All coding must be done in the provided software environment. External IDEs or tools are not allowed.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 ‚Äì Bug Bash
eventRounds.description: Identify and fix bugs in code snippets under a time constraint.

eventRounds.title: Round 2 ‚Äì Algo Blitz
eventRounds.description: Solve algorithmic problems with increasing difficulty. Partial scoring will be based on test case coverage.

eventRounds.title: Final Round ‚Äì Code Sprint
eventRounds.description: A real-world scenario problem with edge cases and optimization needs.

warnings: Basic knowledge of C++/Python/Java is expected.
Be on time for each round.

faqs.question: Can I participate in a group?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can register as a team of 2‚Äì4 members for team rounds.

faqs.question: Which languages are allowed?
faqs.answer: You can choose between C++, Java, or Python.

faqs.question: Do I need to bring my own laptop?
faqs.answer: No, systems will be provided. However, you can bring your own if you prefer.

faqs.question: Will I get a participation certificate?
faqs.answer: Yes, all participants will receive certificates.

eventDescription:
Participants will apply their technical skills and design sensibilities to create **waterproof**, **buoyant** structures capable of maintaining **stability on water**. The challenge is not just about floating ‚Äî it's about **redefining liveable spaces on water**.

During the final test, all models will be placed in water to assess **buoyancy**, **stability**, and **structural integrity** under real conditions. Teams are encouraged to explore **sustainable** and **waterproof materials**, drawing inspiration from modern **amphibious architecture** and **marine engineering**.

---

Whether you're building a floating pavilion or a futuristic water home, this challenge is your platform to **innovate**, **collaborate**, and **make a splash**!

---

### üß© Key Characteristics

1. **Design Requirements**  
   The design should be capable of floating on water. The structure should be designed to support a minimum weight.

2. **Submission Format**  
   A video demonstration or explanation of the design process, making of the structure from scratch, along with a description of the materials and methods used, must accompany the submission.

---

### üìè Model Size Limitation

1. The usable area is **10.00 Sq.m**.
2. The size of the water tank is **1.14m in diameter** and **0.25m in depth**. The model should float easily in the tank.
3. Teams may choose any shape or configuration (e.g., rectangular, modular, circular) within the size limit.
4. There is **no fixed height restriction**, but the structure must remain **balanced, safe, and buoyant** during testing.
5. **Models that exceed the allowed size may be disqualified.**
venue: School of Architecture, DYPSEM, Kasba Bawada, Kolhapur
eligibleParticipants: Competition is open to all students, regardless of department.

rulesAndRegulations.description: All Participants must remain present at the place of competition, 30 min. before starting of event. Late participants will not be allowed to participate.
Students are expected to bring their completed model on the day of competition.
The base must demonstrate buoyancy and hold a minimum weight (to be specified based on competition level ‚Äì e.g., 500 grams or 1kg).
Models must be self-sustaining ‚Äî no external support or hidden flotation is allowed.
Models must float for a minimum time duration (e.g., 2 minutes) without capsizing.
Judges will assess based on: Buoyancy & Stability, Innovation & Design Aesthetics, Structural Integrity, Material Optimization, Sustainability & Creativity.
Participants are free to use any materials of their choice, though the design must be safe and environmentally friendly.
If any participant is found doing wrong practices, he/she will be disqualified from the event.
The organizing team is not responsible for any loss or damage to personal materials

warnings: SUGGESTION: Keep weight low ‚Äî heavier structures are harder to keep afloat Use sealed or closed-cell materials to prevent water absorption. Prioritize eco-friendly or recyclable materials where possible. Reinforce joints and corners with hot glue, zip ties, or waterproof tape.

eventDescription: Launchpad is our version of Shark Tank ‚Äî a dynamic project competition where innovation meets opportunity! Whether you're working on a mini or mega project, this is your stage to pitch your groundbreaking ideas to a panel of experts.
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur, (NOTE: Block/Room details will be shared before the event)
eligibleParticipants: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Team Formation
rulesAndRegulations.description: Team Size: 1 or 2 members only. Interdisciplinary teams are encouraged. No participant can register in more than one team.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Pitch Time
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each team will be given 5 minutes for their pitch. Followed by 2 minutes of Q&A from the judges.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Presentation Tools
rulesAndRegulations.description: Allowed formats: PPTs, prototypes, posters, or videos. A projector and laptop will be provided (inform organizers in advance).

rulesAndRegulations.title: Code of Conduct
rulesAndRegulations.description: Judges‚Äô decisions are final and binding. Maintain professionalism and mutual respect.

rulesAndRegulations.title: About the Event
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants must select any existing product, website, or service and innovate it to create a unique version that does not already exist in the market. Teams will then pitch this innovation as a startup idea in front of judges acting as investors.

rulesAndRegulations.title: What to Innovate
rulesAndRegulations.description: Choose any real-world product, website, or service. Reimagine or innovate it with a new feature, design, use-case, or target market. It must not already exist in the market. You must support this with competitor analysis.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Pitch Components (You can use these as keywords in your presentation)
rulesAndRegulations.description: Problem Statement. Innovative Solution. Target Audience. Competitor Analysis. Market Research. Market Size. Business Model. Unit Economics. Pricing Strategy. Marketing Plan. Scalability and Expansion. Financial Forecast (Optional but preferred). Equity Split (if applicable). Investment Ask

eventRounds.title: Round 1 - Presentation and Evaluation
eventRounds.description: Evaluation will be done on the basis of Usefulness to the society, Inovation, Cost effective, feasibility and understanding.

eventDescription:
Poster IntelliQuest is a dynamic poster presentation event themed "AI in Action: From Perception to Decision." It invites students to creatively showcase how AI technologies like Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, and Expert Systems turn raw data into smart, real-world decisions.
From recognizing faces to driving cars and translating languages‚Äîthis is your chance to explore and present how AI thinks, learns, and acts. Dive into the AI lifecycle, express your ideas visually, and inspire innovation through your poster!
Let your poster do the talking ‚Äî where intelligence meets imagination.
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur, (NOTE: Block/Room details will be shared before the event)
eligibleParticipants: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Eligibility
rulesAndRegulations.description: Open to all undergraduate students. Participation can be individual or in a team of up to 2 members.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Poster Guidelines
rulesAndRegulations.description: Theme: AI and its Subdomains (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, Robotics, Expert Systems, etc.). Poster Size: A1 (594 x 841 mm), in portrait or landscape orientation. Medium: Only hand-made posters are allowed (must be mentioned clearly at the time of registration). Posters must be self-explanatory, visually engaging, and should include:   Title,   Objective,   Methodology,   Conclusion/Impact.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Presentation Format
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each participant/team will have 5 minutes for presentation and 2 minutes for Q&A. Presenters must explain the content without reading directly from the poster. Use of additional props or digital slides is not permitted.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Judging Criteria
rulesAndRegulations.description: Relevance to the theme. Creativity and visual appeal. Clarity of thought and communication. Depth of understanding. Overall presentation skills.

rulesAndRegulations.title: General Rules
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants must report 30 minutes before the event begins. Posters must be submitted one day prior to the event via a Google Drive link (will be shared on the event‚Äôs WhatsApp group). Judges‚Äô decisions are final and binding.

eventDescription: Dare to Battle is an electrifying eSports showdown featuring popular mobile games like Free Fire and BGMI. It‚Äôs the ultimate test of reflexes, strategy, and teamwork! Compete against the best, rise through the ranks, and battle for victory, glory, and awesome prizes.
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur, ** (Classroom 306 & 307) **
eligibleParticipants: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Offline Mode
rulesAndRegulations.description: The game will be played in an Offline  mode. Ensure that you have a stable internet  connection to participate without interruptions.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Cheating and Hacks Policy
rulesAndRegulations.description: Any form of cheating or hacking during the game will lead to immediate disqualification  of the entire team. We encourage fair play and sportsmanship. Any suspicious behavior  should be reported to the organizers for review.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Joining Custom Matches
rulesAndRegulations.description: All instructions for joining the custom matches will be communicated through the  designated WhatsApp group. Please ensure you are a member of this group to receive  timely updates and essential information regarding match details, including dates,  times, and joining links.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Final Decisions
rulesAndRegulations.description: All final decisions regarding the game rules, disputes, and any other matters will be  made by the coordinators. Their decisions are final and must be respected by all  participants.
No Refunds will be provided. Join Only One Game FF/BGMI

rulesAndRegulations.title: Point Table For BGMI
rulesAndRegulations.description: 1 position 10 points.  2 position 8 points.  3 position 6 points.  4 position 5 points.  5 position 4 points.  6 position 3 points.  7 position 2 points.  8 to 25 position no points.  1 kill = 1 point.

eventDescription: A Design Relay is a collaborative and competitive design challenge where teams of designers work together to complete a series of design tasks, often with a specific theme or objective.
venue: School of Architecture, DYPSEM, Kasba Bawada, Kolhapur.
eligibleParticipants: Architecture Students

rulesAndRegulations.title: Material Requirement
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants are free to use any type of presentation technique, manual/digital (ppt, photoshop, SketchUp, etc.)  Teams must compile all their design contents together and create a digital sheet presentation on A2 size. Participants are requested to bring their own materials required for this competition.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Key Characteristics
rulesAndRegulations.description: Time-sensitive: Teams have a limited amount of time (e.g., 60-90 minutes) to complete each design task. Sequential challenges: Teams participate in a series of design challenges, each building upon the previous one. Collaborative problem-solving: Team members work together to brainstorm, sketch, and refine their designs
Team should consist of minimum 3 and 4 maximum members.
Participants are encouraged to collaborate within their team and share ideas freely.
Each group will get 2.5 hours to complete their design.
Participants should switch design responsibilities after a predefined time interval.
The order of design rotation (who designs first, second, and third) should be maintained throughout the challenge.
Pre discussion time will be 15 min before the start of the competition.
Any use of plagiarized content, designs, or ideas will result in disqualification.
Any violation of the rules, submission guidelines, or misconduct may lead to disqualification.
The participating teams should be present at the venue 30 minutes before the competition starts.
No late or on spot entries will be entertained

eventDescription: The competition will be conducted in teams, with each team consisting of 2 members. Teams will compete through multiple rounds, each focusing on different facets of engineering. These rounds will test participants' ability to apply theoretical knowledge to practical scenarios, push their creative boundaries, and collaborate effectively under time constraints.
venue: School of Architecture, DYPSEM, Kasba Bawada, Kolhapur.
eligibleParticipants: Open for all department

rulesAndRegulations.title: REGISTRATION
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each team must register using the Google Form. Registration entries are allowed only till 22nd April,2025, 12:00 noon. No on spot entries are allowed.
All Participants must remain present at the place of competition, 30 min. before starting of event. Late participants will not be allowed to participate.
Each group must consist of only two members. Students can collaborate across departments and participate in pairs for the competition.
Participants should maintain respect towards the host, judges, and other competitors throughout the event.
All decisions made by the judges are final. No disputes regarding scores or decisions will be entertained.
Any team found violating the competition rules (e.g., cheating, disruptive behavior, using unauthorized materials) will be immediately disqualified from the competition.
Registration will be open till 22nd April 2025 till 12.00 noon.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 General Knowledge
eventRounds.description: In Round 1 will have Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs), results will be scored based on the accuracy of answers. In this round the lowest scorer/ team will be eliminated.

eventRounds.title: Round 2 Visual Round/ Scenario-Based Questions
eventRounds.description: Teams will be presented with a real-world engineering challenge or problem

eventRounds.title: Round 3 (FINAL) Rapid Fire (Head to Head)
eventRounds.description: The final round is a one-on-one battle between the top teams.

eventDescription:
Showcasing your mini and mega projects in the field of Project areas
Chemical, biotechnology, pharmaceutical, nanotechnology, environmental and any project related to betterment of society.
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur **(NOTE: Block/Room details will be shared before the event)
eligibleParticipants: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.

rulesAndRegulations.description: There shall be minimum 3 and maximum 5 members in a team.
Project should be in following areas :-Chemical, biotechnology, pharmaceutical, nanotechnology, environmental and any project related to betterment of society.
Students can  present their project in the form of prototype, ppt, design or any other form to give the information about the project.
Project will be evaluated on the basis of Usefulness to the society, Enovation, Cost effective, feasibility and understanding.

eventRounds.description: Evaluation will be done on the basis of Usefulness to the society, Enovation, Cost effective, feasibility and understanding.

eventDescription: Join our Product Development Competition, where innovation meets impact! This competition challenges participants to design, develop, and present a novel product that addresses real-world needs. Teams will work through stages of ideation, prototyping, and validation, receiving mentorship from industry experts along the way. Finalists will showcase their solutions to a panel of judges for a chance to win prizes, gain recognition, and potentially bring their product to market.
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur **(NOTE: Block/Room details will be shared before the event)
eligibleParticipants: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.

rulesAndRegulations.description: There shall be minimum 3 and maximum 4 members in a team.
Students should bring the sample of the product and has to showcase along with its information.
Students can prepare PPT presentation to give the information about the product.
Product will be evaluated on the basis of Usefulness to the society, Enovation, Cost effective, feasibility and understanding.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 - Presentation and Evaluation
eventRounds.description: Evaluation will be done on the basis of Usefulness to the society, Enovation, Cost effective, feasibility and understanding.

eventDescription: Unleash your creativity and engineering skills in our Model Making Competition! Participants are invited to design and build detailed models that bring concepts to life ‚Äî from scientific structures and architectural wonders to innovative machines and futuristic ideas. This competition emphasizes precision, creativity, and practical thinking. Showcase your craftsmanship and originality to a panel of judges and compete for exciting prizes. Whether you work solo or in a team, this is your chance to turn your vision into a tangible masterpiece!
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur **(NOTE: Block/Room details will be shared before the event)
eligibleParticipants: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.

rulesAndRegulations.description: Model / Demo of experiment set up allowed.
Same model/poster presentations are not allowed for other competition.
During competition bring your own equipment‚Äôs/setup/model
Time allotted to one group for explanation is 7 minute.
Question and answer session will be for 3 minute.
Maximum 3 Participants are allowed per group.

eventDescription: Model bridges promote the study and application of engineering and help students develop ‚Äúhands-on‚Äù skills. Participating students get to experience what it is to be an engineer, designing structures to a set of specifications and then see them perform their function.
venue: Geo-Technical Engineering lab, Civil Engineering Department.
eligibleParticipants: Degree and Diploma Students

rulesAndRegulations.description: Max 2 Participants per team are allowed.
Only Ice-cream sticks and Fevicol is allowed.
Students can use differentials of total Truss cross section should be limited 100 mm x 100mm only
Strength to weight ratio will be calculated and then will be decided
Load will be applied at center of the structure.
Judge‚Äôs decision will be final.
Load to Weight ratio will decide the winner.
Shape profile id final. Participants can vary internal arrangements of ice-cream sticks.

eventDescription: Infinity Hunt is a thrilling treasure hunt-style event that combines the excitement of discovery with the challenge of mental acuity. The event features a unique combination of aptitude questions, coding challenges, and engaging puzzles. Participants will solve clues, crack codes, and race against time to reach the final destination
venue: Material Testing lab, Civil Engineering Department.
eligibleParticipants: Open to all Students of any Department or Year. ** (NOTE: Form Team 4 members).**

rulesAndRegulations.description: Prepare only one concrete cube of 40 N/mm2 compressive strength at 7 days curing period.
Mix design report should be compulsorily signed by Head of Department of your respective institute.
The size of cube should be 150mm X 150mm X 150mm.
Use of any type of chemical admixture is allowed.
Use of fiber/ mesh or any other reinforcement is not allowed.
Compressive strength nearer to (+/-) 40 N/mm2 will be the winner.
Strength / weight ratio will be considered for declaration of result.

eventDescription:
THE DESIGNER event is a dynamic and engaging competition designed to showcase and challenge your skills in Computer-Aided Design (CAD). This event provides a platform for participants to demonstrate their proficiency in creating precise, innovative, and functional digital models using industry-standard CAD software.
Participants will be presented with a specific design problem or challenge. The core of the event lies in your ability to translate conceptual ideas and technical specifications into accurate and detailed digital representations.
venue: Computer lab, Civil Engineering Department.
eligibleParticipants: Degree and Diploma Students

rulesAndRegulations.title: Round 1 ‚Äì (Scrutiny Round)
rulesAndRegulations.description: First round will be of MCQ‚Äôs.  Total 25 questions, 2 marks for each correct answer.  There will be negative marking of 1 mark of each wrong answer.  Time limit: 15 min.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Round 2
rulesAndRegulations.description: Round 2 will be of designing a plan on Auto CAD. Time limit: 1.5 hours Time limit will be strictly considered.  College computers will be provided for the round. No personal laptops are allowed.  Plan must contain all details mentioned in the question.  File must be of minimum size (in KB).

rulesAndRegulations.title: Round 3 ‚Äì (in case of tie only)
rulesAndRegulations.description: Time limit: half an hour.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Parameters for evaluation
rulesAndRegulations.description: Timely completion.  Orientation of plan.  Presentation skills. Other factors (such as scale, text, accuracy, dimensions, hatching, file size, etc.).  Decision of the Judges will be final.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 : Scrutiny Round
eventRounds.description: First round will be of MCQ‚Äôs.  Total 25 questions, 2 marks for each correct answer.  There will be negative marking of 1 mark of each wrong answer.  Time limit: 15 min.

eventRounds.title: Round 2
eventRounds.description: Round 2 will be of designing a plan on Auto CAD. Time limit: 1.5 hours Time limit will be strictly considered.  College computers will be provided for the round. No personal laptops are allowed.  Plan must contain all details mentioned in the question.  File must be of minimum size (in KB).

eventRounds.title: Round 3 ‚Äì (in case of tie only)
eventRounds.description: Time limit: half an hour.

warnings: If participant is found doing cheating, he/she will be eliminated there itself.
Mobiles and other electronic devices are not allowed.

eventDescription: The Android App Development Competition provides a platform for aspiring developers to present their innovative mobile application solutions. Participants will have the opportunity to showcase their technical skills, creativity, and business acumen in front of industry experts.
venue: Classroom No. 303
eligibleParticipants: Open to all Students of any Department or Year. (Note 1 or 2 members).

rulesAndRegulations.title: Presentation & Demonstration Round
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each team will have a total of 13 minutes, divided as follows: 5 minutes ‚Äì Presentation of the app concept and its significance. 3 minutes ‚Äì Live demonstration of the app's functionality. 5 minutes ‚Äì Question-and-answer session with the judging panel. The evaluation will be based on distinct criteria in each segment.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Team Structure
rulesAndRegulations.description: The competition is open to individuals or teams consisting of up to two members.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 Presentation & Demonstration Round
eventRounds.description:
Presentation (5 Minutes) 
Application Demonstration (3 Minutes) 
Question & Answer Session (5 Minutes)

eventDescription:
Infinity Hunt is a thrilling treasure hunt-style event that combines the excitement of discovery with the challenge of mental acuity.
The event features a unique combination of aptitude questions, coding challenges, and engaging puzzles. Participants will solve clues, crack codes, and race against time to reach the final destination
venue: New Building including Labs, cabins
eligibleParticipants: First year to Final Year Students.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Mandatory Attendance
rulesAndRegulations.description: All participants must report on time and attend the entire event from start to end (9:30 AM to 3:30 PM). Late entries or early exits may lead to disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Group Participation Etiquette
rulesAndRegulations.description: Groups must stay together during the hunt. Splitting up to solve clues individually is not allowed and will result in penalty points.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Respect for Venue
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants must not damage property or tamper with equipment in labs, cabins, or buildings. Any such behavior will lead to immediate disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: No External Help
rulesAndRegulations.description: The use of mobile phones, the internet, or assistance from outsiders is strictly prohibited unless specified in a challenge. All answers must be solved independently by the team.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Clue Integrity
rulesAndRegulations.description: Do not remove, hide, or alter any clues once found. If you find a clue meant for another team, report it to the coordinators.

eventDescription: The event consists of three exciting rounds. The first round, Code Relay, tests teamwork as each member contributes to solving a coding problem in a relay format. In the second round, Debugging, teams must identify and fix errors in a buggy code within a set time limit. The final round, Code Fire, challenges participants with a complex coding problem under high pressure, often with unexpected twists like limited resources or surprise bugs, pushing their problem-solving and adaptability to the limit.
venue: New Building
eligibleParticipants: Open to all Students of any Department or Year. ** (NOTE: Form Team 4 members.).**

rulesAndRegulations.title: Team Size
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each team must consist of 4 members.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Registration Fee
rulesAndRegulations.description: A registration fee of 100 rupees per head must be paid before participating in the competition.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Eligibility
rulesAndRegulations.description: The competition is open to engineering and diploma students only.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Code of Conduct
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants are expected to maintain a professional and respectful attitude during the competition.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Judging Criteria
rulesAndRegulations.description: Judges will evaluate teams based on their coding skills, problem-solving abilities, and teamwork.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Time Limits
rulesAndRegulations.description: Time limits will be strictly enforced for each round.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 Code Relay
eventRounds.description: Teams will be given a coding challenge to complete in a relay format. Each team member must contribute to the solution.

eventRounds.title: Round 2 Debugging
eventRounds.description: Teams will be given a buggy code to debug within a set time limit.

eventRounds.title: Round 3 Code Fire
eventRounds.description: Teams will be given a complex coding problem to solve under time pressure, with a twist (e.g., limited resources, unexpected errors).

eventDescription: Robo Race is a thrilling contest where students build and control robots to race through a track, testing speed, precision, and obstacle navigation while encouraging innovation and teamwork
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur **(NOTE: Block/Room details will be shared before the event)
eligibleParticipants: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Timer Start & End
rulesAndRegulations.description: The timer starts when the robot begins moving from the starting line. The timer stops only when the robot crosses the finish line. If the robot encounters issues during the run, only one opportunity will be given to fix the defects within a limited time.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Track Rules
rulesAndRegulations.description: The robot must stay on the designated track. If the robot goes off-track, it must return to the last checkpoint crossed. The timer will continue running during this time.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Penalties
rulesAndRegulations.description: Skipping any obstacle: 30-second penalty per obstacle. Touching the robot by hand during the race: 10-second penalty per instance.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Winning Criteria
rulesAndRegulations.description: The robot with the lowest total time (including penalties) will be declared the winner.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Robot Specifications
rulesAndRegulations.description: Control: Manually operated (wired or wireless). Size Limit: Maximum 250mm √ó 250mm √ó 250mm. Weight Limit: Maximum 3 kg. Construction: Use of Lego parts or ready-made kits is not allowed.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Power Source
rulesAndRegulations.description: Maximum 12V battery permitted. Teams must carry an extra battery. Battery failure may result in time loss or disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Team Rules
rulesAndRegulations.description: Maximum of 2 members per team.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Fair Play
rulesAndRegulations.description: Damaging the track or interfering with other robots will lead to immediate disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Authority & Rule Changes
rulesAndRegulations.description: All decisions made by the judges and organizing committee are final and binding. The organizing committee reserves the right to modify the rules at any time.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Track Description
rulesAndRegulations.description: The track will include rough terrain with various obstacles such as: Ramps,Bridges,Speed breakers, Slippery paths, And more.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Spot Entry Details
rulesAndRegulations.description: Spot Entry Fee: ‚Çπ200 per team. Spot Entry with Robot Provided: ‚Çπ250 per team. Note: Robots provided by the committee will be allotted on a first-come, first-serve basis (limited availability).

eventDescription: This event is specially designed for students who have a passion for computer-aided design and want to showcase their creativity, speed, and technical skills. CAD Clash will test participants' knowledge and hands-on abilities in design software through multiple engaging rounds.
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur **(NOTE: Block/Room details will be shared before the event)
eligibleParticipants: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.

rulesAndRegulations.description: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.
Students must bring their valid College ID card for verification during registration/check-in.
Only individual participation is allowed.: No team or group entries.
No malpractice is allowed.: Any form of cheating, copying, or misconduct will lead to immediate disqualification.
Round 1 (Quiz Round) will be conducted online. Participants must bring their mobile phones with sufficient battery and internet access for this round.
Round 1 (Quiz Round) and Round 2 (2D Drafting) are elimination rounds. The number of participants eliminated in each round will be decided based on the total number of entries.
Round 2 will be conducted strictly on AutoCAD. (System for this round will be provided by the organizing team), No other software is allowed for this round.

UG NX 9.0 will be provided by the organizing team for the final round.: If you wish to use any other CAD software in the final round, you must bring your own laptop with the required software pre-installed, along with a mouse, charger, and necessary accessories.
Time limits for each round will be announced during the event.: Participants must complete all tasks within the given time.
In case of a tie in the final round, a surprise modelling task will be given as a tiebreaker.
Files must be saved and submitted in the specified format.: File naming and formats will be explained during the event.
Participants are fully responsible for their own devices and software performance.: No technical support will be provided for personal laptops/software.
Final round will be judged based on: Minimum number of steps/features used ‚Äì Minimum time taken to complete the design.
Respectful behavior is mandatory.: Misconduct toward judges, volunteers, or fellow participants will result in disqualification.
Late arrivals will not be given extra time.
Depending on the number of entries or other unavoidable circumstances, the organizing committee reserves the right to cancel or modify any round.
Participation certificates will be awarded to all verified participants.
Winners will receive prize money and winning certificates.
Judges‚Äô decision will be final.: No objections or disputes will be entertained.

eventRounds.title: Round 1: Quiz Round (Elimination Round)
eventRounds.description: This is an online quiz that will test your basic knowledge about CAD software, design standards and general engineering concepts. Participants will need to answer multiple-choice questions within a limited time.

eventRounds.title: Round 2: 2D Drafting on AutoCAD (Elimination Round)
eventRounds.description: Qualified participants from the quiz round will move to the 2D drawing round. You will be asked to create a 2D drawing of a given drawing using AutoCAD. The type of drawing‚ÄîOrthographic or Isometric‚Äîwill be disclosed at the time of the event. This round will test your accuracy, understanding of 2D views, and ability to follow dimensions properly. Note: Only AutoCAD is allowed for this round.

eventRounds.title: Round 3: 3D Modelling Round
eventRounds.description: Finalists will face a 3D modelling challenge. You will be given a drawing of a mechanical part, and you‚Äôll have to create a 3D model using CAD software. UG NX 9.0 will be provided on the college systems. However, if you prefer to use a different software like SolidWorks, Fusion 360, CATIA etc. you are welcome to use your own laptop ‚Äì just make sure the software is pre-installed and your device is ready to use. This round will be judged based on how quickly and efficiently you model the part, including the number of steps used.

venue: Classroom 226
eligibleParticipants: Open for All

rulesAndRegulations.description: Entry Fee ‚Äì 100/- (Per Participant). Maximum allowed entries per group is 2.
Language of conduct ‚Äì English
Topics will be given on the spot
Every participant should speak during the debate
Abusive language strictly prohibited
Judges decision will be the FINAL
Changes may occur in event structure as per the circumstances
Competition Structure is as follows

eventRounds.title: Quiz Round  (Elimination)
eventRounds.description: A Quiz on general Engineering eg. Mechanical, Automobile etc

eventRounds.title: Tech Debate
eventRounds.description: Debate on a technical topic randomly picked from ‚ÄòCHITS BOWL‚Äô on the spot. Preparation time of 5 mins with smartphone, then 7 mins for debate, 1 min for conclusion.

eventRounds.title: Final Round
eventRounds.description: Shortlisted teams from round 2 will pick the chits again for topics, Preparation time of 10 mins, No smartphone allowed, 7 mins for debate, 1 min to conclude.

venue: E&TC Dept. Labs
eligibleParticipants: Any Project from Electronics & Telecommunication field

rulesAndRegulations.description: Max 5 Participant per team are allowed.
Only the registered participants will be allowed to participate in the event.
The participants should bring their own Laptop/Systems for the presentation / demonstration of their Project.
The participants should ensure that they have a hardware/software with them required for their Project.
Every Participated members will get certificates after event
Judge's decision will be Final.

venue: College Lawn
eligibleParticipants: First year to Final Year Students.

rulesAndRegulations.description: There shall be minimum 2 and maximum 4 members in a team.
Single Attachment Rule: Each robot is allowed only one attachment for hitting or controlling the ball.
Qualification Criteria: Any team that scores maximum goals within the 2 halfs of 3-minute match will qualify for the next round.
Judge's Decision: The decisions made by the judges regarding results, robot specifications, and other event-related issues are final and binding.
Size: 25*20*157. Weight 3 kg

venue: College Lawn
eligibleParticipants: First year to Final Year Students.

rulesAndRegulations.description: Drone should be fly only in given area.
All the connection and control system should be check properly before flight.
Drone pilot should be well experienced.
Only stable Drone are allowed to fly
Take-off and landing should be in safe way.
Under any uncertain conditions / malfunctions occurred during the take away, the drone should be moved away from the crowded area & should be landed at safe place.
Selection will be based on application of drone, how it will be helpful to the society. Judge‚Äôs decision will be final.

eventDescription:
DAY 1
Workshop
The Blender 3D Modeling Workshop & Competition is a hands-on learning experience designed to teach participants the fundamentals of 3D modeling, texturing, lighting, and basic animation using Blender, an industry-standard, open-source 3D software. Ideal for beginners and intermediate learners, the workshop helps unlock creative potential while providing practical skills applicable to game development, animation, product design, and more. Participants will not only build their portfolios but also compete to showcase their talent, win prizes, and receive certificates, all while networking with like-minded creatives and learning from experienced mentors.

DAY 2
Competition:
There will be a surprise competition at the end of the workshop based on the modules covered, so make sure to pay close attention.
venue: CSE Building Lab [2,3,5,6] D. Y.  Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur
eligibleParticipants: Open to all students of any department or year

rulesAndRegulations.title: Mandatory Attendance:
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants must attend the full two-day workshop to be eligible for the surprise competition and to receive the participation certificate.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Punctuality:
rulesAndRegulations.description: All participants must report on time. Late entries may lead to disqualification from the competition.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Mandatory Equipment:
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each participant must bring their own laptop (with Blender version 3.6 or above installed) and a functional mouse. Sharing of equipment is not allowed.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Original Work:
rulesAndRegulations.description: All 3D models must be created during the competition hours. The use of pre-made assets or previously created work is strictly prohibited unless specifically provided by the organizers.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Respect & Conduct:
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants must maintain a respectful and collaborative environment throughout the event. Any form of misconduct or disturbance will lead to immediate disqualification

rulesAndRegulations.title: Module-Based Challenge: [Surprise Competition Rules]
rulesAndRegulations.description: A surprise competition will be held at the end of the workshop based on the concepts covered during the sessions. Participants should be well-versed with all modules.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Theme Disclosure  [Surprise Competition Rules]
rulesAndRegulations.description: The competition theme will be announced at the beginning of the challenge. Submissions must align strictly with the revealed theme.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Time Limit [Surprise Competition Rules]:
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants must submit both the final 3D model and the rendered output before the deadline (01:30 PM).

rulesAndRegulations.title: No External Help  [Surprise Competition Rules]:
rulesAndRegulations.description: Use of internet tutorials, mobile phones, or assistance from others during the competition is not allowed.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Submission Format  [Surprise Competition Rules]:
rulesAndRegulations.description: The final submission must include the .blend file along with a rendered image in PNG or JPEG format.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Judging Criteria
rulesAndRegulations.description: 1) Creativity & Concept ‚Äì 30%. 2)Technical Execution ‚Äì 30%. 3) Aesthetic & Detailing ‚Äì 20%. 4) Presentation / Render Quality ‚Äì 20%. 5) Judges' Decision: The decision made by the judging panel will be final and binding.

warnings: Be prepared‚Äîyour learning will be tested in the most creative way!

eventDescription:
IPL Auction is a thrilling event that replicates the real Indian Premier League auction environment, where participants form teams, bid for players, and strategically build their Dream11-style squad.
This event blends cricket knowledge, decision-making, and team coordination into an exciting two-stage competition.
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur, **(NOTE: Block/Room details will be shared before the event)**
eligibleParticipants: Open to all students of any department or year. (NOTE: Form a team of 3-4 members).

rulesAndRegulations.title: Total teams
rulesAndRegulations.description: 60 (Max 3-4 members each).
Max 4 students per team
Top 10 scoring teams will qualify for the Mega Auction Round.
Qualified teams will be assigned one IPL franchise randomly (e.g. MI, CSK, RCB, etc.).
Each team will be given a virtual purse of ‚Çπ100 Crores.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Base price increases
rulesAndRegulations.description: ‚Çπ50L per bid till ‚Çπ10 Cr. ‚Çπ1 Cr per bid after ‚Çπ10 Cr.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Teams must form squads with
rulesAndRegulations.description: Minimum: 5 Batsmen.  1 Wicketkeeper.  2 All-Rounder.  3 Bowlers. Max 4 Foreign Players. Must not exceed ‚Çπ100 crore purse. Teams must stay within budget.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Winner Criteria
rulesAndRegulations.description: Team Balance & Player Rating (based on Dream11 stats/performance). Smart use of purse money. Following team composition rules strictly. Includes refreshments, team management sheets, and live animated auction setup. Auction will be conducted with live bidding slides like real IPL. Coordinated by technical, auction, doc, and management teams.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 IPL Quiz
eventRounds.description: Questions related to IPL teams, players, stats, and records Top 10 scoring teams qualify for the next round

eventRounds.title: Round 2 Live IPL Auction
eventRounds.description: Each team is assigned a real IPL franchise (randomly) Teams bid for players with a limited budget and form a full squad (as per IPL rules)

eventDescription: Reel Rumble is a solo reel-making competition organized under Technotsav 2025, designed to capture the energy, creativity, and vibrance of the fest. Participants will shoot, edit, and submit their reels over the two-day span of the event, showcasing highlights from Day 1 and Day 2 of Technotsav. The competition encourages storytelling, content creation, and smart editing‚Äîall within a 90-second reel format.
venue: DY Patil College of Engineering & Technology (DYPCET), Kolhapur, **(NOTE:  Block/Room details will be shared before the event)
eligibleParticipants: Open to all students of any department or year , Solo participation only

rulesAndRegulations.description: Students from Diploma and Undergraduate (UG) programs are eligible to participate.
Students must bring their valid College ID card for verification during registration/check-in.
Only individual participation is allowed.: No team or group entries.
Respectful behaviour is mandatory.: Misconduct toward judges, volunteers, or fellow participants will result in disqualification.
Late arrivals will not be given extra time.
Participation certificates will be awarded to all verified participants.
Winners will receive prize money and winning certificates.
Judges‚Äô decision will be final.: No objections or disputes will be entertained.
Participants are fully responsible for their own devices and software performance.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Reel Guidelines:
rulesAndRegulations.description: Solo participation only. Reel Duration: Max 90 seconds. Format: Portrait (9:16), suitable for Instagram. Content must be based on Technotsav Day 1 and Day 2. All footage must be shot within the college premises during the event. Use of copyrighted music or video is strictly prohibited, unless credited. Editing must be completed by Day 2. Participants must carry their own materials (phones, tripods, etc). No spot entries allowed.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Posting & Submission
rulesAndRegulations.description: Submission of the final reel must be made via Google Drive link provided by the coordinators. Reels posted after 1:00 PM will not be considered for evaluation. Instagram Posting (Optional) Participants can post their reel using the official hashtags: #ReelRumble2025 #Technotsav2025.  This offers bonus points and acts as a golden pass to boost their chance of winning.
Refreshments will be provided to all registered participants(day 1 and day 2) Winning reels will be highlighted during the Closing Ceremony and promoted as event highlights.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 - One Shot, One Reel
eventRounds.description: Participants have to conceptualize, shoot, and edit a reel based on the given theme. Participants will begin capturing moments, activities and behind-the-scenes of Technotsav. Shooting continues through recording all the events, highlights happening on different venues. respectively.  Day 1 shoot ends at 4:00 PM

eventRounds.title: Submission Round
eventRounds.description: Participants can shoot from 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM (approx) SUBMISSION: Drive link will be open from 12:30PM to 1:00PM Reels uploaded after 1:00PM will not be considered. Instagram bonus(optional): participants can post their edited reel on their instagram handle, this will give them bonus points.

venue: Lab 1 and 2 AIML
eligibleParticipants: Open for all department

rulesAndRegulations.title: Themes for Paper Presentation
rulesAndRegulations.description: Role of Healthcare, Biotechnology, and Bioinformatics. Smart Cities and AI-driven Sustainable Infrastructure. Next-Gen Automation and Perception Systems in Robotics and Vehicles. Cybersecurity in the Age of Zero Trust: Challenges and Innovations. Industry 4.0: Digital Twins and Intelligent Manufacturing. Innovations in Renewable Energy and Smart Power Systems. Advances in Embedded Systems and the Internet of Things (IoT). Role of AI/ML, Data Science, and AR/VR in Engineering Disruption. Circular Economy and Zero-Waste Engineering Practices. Trends in Electrical and Hydrogen Vehicle Technologies. Transformative Engineering Innovations for a Sustainable Future. Quantum Computing and Its Emerging Role in Engineering Applications.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Rules & Regulations
rulesAndRegulations.description: The entire event will be conducted in offline mode. The paper must follow the IEEE format or format shared:- https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/ieee-conference-template/grfzhhncsfqn. Topic should be technical and research-based (from the given list). Submissions must be original and plagiarism-free. A maximum of 4 participants per team is allowed. Students must bring a valid college ID card for verification during registration/check-in. Participation certificates will be awarded to all verified participants. Winners will receive prize money and winning certificates. The judges‚Äô decision will be final. No objections or disputes will be entertained. Refreshments will be provided to all registered participants.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Presentation guidelines
rulesAndRegulations.description: Presentation Format: PPT must be prepared using the official template provided by the organizing team. (It will be provided later). Paper Submission: Submit your paper to dypcettechnotsav25@gmail.com. Email Subject Line should be: TeamLeaderName_CollegeName_TopicNumber.  Presentation Medium: Use of PowerPoint (.ppt/.pptx) or PDF format is allowed. Time Limit: 6 minutes for presentation, 2 minutes for Q&A with judges.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Judging Criteria
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each presentation will be evaluated by a panel of judges using a standardized score sheet based on the below criteria. Research Depth & Originality. Technical Content & Accuracy. Presentation & Communication Skills. Handling of Questions (Q&A).

rulesAndRegulations.title: Paper Format
rulesAndRegulations.description: IEEE

rulesAndRegulations.title: PPT must be in
rulesAndRegulations.description: format provided by team

rulesAndRegulations.title: Time limit
rulesAndRegulations.description: 6 Minutes Presentation + 2 Minutes Q&A

rulesAndRegulations.title: Registration/Deadline for paper submission
rulesAndRegulations.description: 21 April 2025

rulesAndRegulations.title: Acceptance will be declared by
rulesAndRegulations.description: 22 April 2025(via mail)
